question: Question_12_(g)
statement:
Mark each statement either True or False. You do not have to justify
your answer.

If \textless{}v1,...,vn\textgreater{} span $\mathbb{R}^5$ then n = 5
sols:
\textbf{False}. If \textless{}v1,...,vn\textgreater{} were linearly
independent of each other then it can be said that n = 5
(i.e.\textless{}v1,..,vn\textgreater{} is a basis), however,
\textless{}v1,...,vn\textgreater{} it is possible for n to be any number
of vectors but still span R\textsuperscript{5} given that some of the
vectors are linearly dependent.
